pullRequest.title: Seperate field errors into Warnings and errors
pullRequest.bodyText: This PR is for setting up the groundwork for us to differentiate between warnings and errors in Alert. Currently, with this PR all the functionality should remain the same as all the fields that are created are errors. After this we will review the fields we want to be converted to warnings and make the appropriate changes.

nodes.bodyText: If this is commented out and not needed, it should just be deleted.

commit.message: style: Removing comments

nodes.bodyText: I think it would be a good time to stop using a map here and start using an object that handles all this. It would clear up some code and make it easier to understand.

You can abstract this further by creating a private method that is passed a function. The function will either do getErrors or getWarnings. You'd then call the method twice here with different functions passed.

You can add a method to AlertFieldsStatus called getSeverityName that does this
alertFieldStatus.getSeverity().name()
These can be converted into const if you use a ternary operator like you did on line 30 and 31

commit.message: refactor: Move AlertFieldStatus and FieldErrorsSeverity to a new package
refactor: Change AlertFieldStatus to store the the FieldName rather than use a map for AlertFieldException
refactor: Update classes to remove HashMaps and use new AlertFieldStatus object
test: Update tests to use Lists of AlertFieldStatus over HashMaps
refactor: Update ValidationResult by making duplicate streams into private method
refactor: Update LabelField to use ternary operator
style: Removing comments and renaming variables
refactor: Add new static method to DataStructureUtils
